p: Mucuna pruriens (Fabaceae) is native to tropical climate, particularly India, Africa, and some parts of China [ 1]. It is an annual climbing legume with fleshy pods containing about six ellipsoid seeds [ 2]. M. pruriens is a valuable medicinal plant used to treat several diseases like malaria, cancer, epilepsy, Parkinsonâ€™s disease, diarrhea, helminthiasis, ulcer, infertility, snakebite, scorpion stings, and elephantiasis [ 1, 3, 4, 5]. The plant serves as a cover crop usually cultivated as effective green manure to replenish devastated soil due to its ability to accumulate nutrients in various environments [ 6, 7]. It exhibits allelopathy to weed growth and is efficient in reducing the nematode population in farms [ 1, 8].
